result.execSummary:
The defendant Pierre Jackson Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Pierre Jackson Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Pierre Jackson Miller was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Pierre Jackson Miller is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Pierre Jackson Miller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 14 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 14 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED the Defendant to pay ONLY the MANDATORY costs, fees assessments due on or before 09-10-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
COURT ORDDRED the Defendant to NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Sarah McNutt for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested court address no contact order. Court agreed to modify no contact order as defendant's biological children to allow contact as a approved by Family Court Order dated after today's date. As to D.L. court ordered no contact unless approved by BMCW. Case remains set for Sentencing on 9/10/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense counsel reqeusted case be set for a Bail Hearing. ADA advised. Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing on 8/19/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock via telephone.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Attorney Hailstock unable to appear in Jury Trial in branch 25. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 659
cf
Court VACATED Body Attachement: KEONDRA METHS.

CASE RECALLED, appearances remain the same.
At the hour of 10:39 AM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict which was then read.  
COUNT 1: NOT GUILTY
COUNT 2: GUILTY
COUNT 4: NOT GUILTY
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict on Count 2, and judgment of acquittal on Counts 1 & 4. Court DENIED defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to Count 2.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to Count 2. Court entered judgment of acquittal as to Counts 1 & 4. Exhibit List, Received & Filed. Court VACATED the Body Attachment for witness: Keondra Meths at request of the state. State's motion for remand pending sentencing, DENIED. Case set for Sentencing in branch 23 post rotation, court with retain this case for sentencing. Defendant advised of firearm prohibition after this conviction of a crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling issues discussed on the record. Defendant sworn. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify. Court found that the defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to testify. Defendant will not testify. Jury in the box. Defense rests. No rebuttal from the state. Testimony closed.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:55 AM to deliberate in the charge of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Deputies who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Case in recess pending verdict.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial issues placed on the record. State's motion to Dismiss Count 3 due to inability to proceed, GRANTED by the court. Count 3 Dismissed. Jury in the box, SWORN to try the case. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Telecommunications worker Annie Gray. Sworn for the state; MPD Telecommunications worker Katrina Gardner. Exhibits #11 & #12 received and published. Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Jullian Goggans. Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Cassandra Benitez. Sworn for the state: MPD Sgt. Timothy Gauerke. Received & Published exhibits #1-10. Jury out of the box. Court in recess. Jury in the box. Recalled, previously sworn: MPD Officer Jullian Goggans. State rested subject to rebuttal. Jury instructed and released for the day. Jury ordered to return on 6/24/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23. Jury out of the box. Defense motion to dismiss at close of the state's case, as to Counts 1 & 2 and 4, DENIED for reasons placed on the record. Discussion regarding side bar conversations and scheduling issues. Case adjourned to branch 23 on 6/24/2015 at 8:30 AM.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pretrial issues and motions addressed on the record. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded. Jury out of the box. Court held in chambers, reporter, clerk and all parties present. Discussion regarding side bar conversations. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. Court resumed in courtroom. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Remaining panel members released to Jury Management. Court instructed the Jury, and released Jury for lunch. and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Jury out of the box. Sidebar conversations placed on the record. Case adjourned to 1:30 PM.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Received & Filed, Amended Criminal Complaint & Amended Information.
Per Complaint & Information 
On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 4 Added: Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500.00), Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Court reviewed the complaint and information and found probable cause. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3rd call of the case. Court held in chambers conference with both parties. Discussion regarding 911 CD, and copies provided to the court and defense. Arguments form the state and defense. For reasons placed on the record the court admitted the 911 calls. Parties ready to proceed to trial, case passed to 8:30 AM on 6/23/2015 in branch 23.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Discussion regarding availability of state's witness. State requested a Body Attachment for Keondra L. Meths. Court GRANTED the Body Attachment. Case passed to 1:30 PM to address court calendar.
BODY ATTACHMENT: Keondra L. Meths

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is set for Jury Trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear. State is requesting a Body Attachment in this matter. Defense counsel objected to the Body Attachment. Court passed case to address court calendar.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. State REVOKED offer in this case. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 06/22/2015.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All motions to be filed, and discovery turned over 20 DAYS in advance of next court date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
All bail conditions remain in effect.
Bail motion by defense argued. State objects.  Motion granted by the Court.  Court ordered $500.00 signature bond with continued turnover to Justice Point.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KEONDRA M., SONYA W., D.L.T. (11/06/04),  KW. (12/23/02) AND K.W. (10/18/14).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Pierre Jackson Miller in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
